text: this is Jeffrey gentlemen of the New
York Times after suffering in silence
for years a few women here in eastern
Congo are speaking out for the first
time about the country's rape epidemic
United Nations officials and foreign
activists recently organized an event in
bukavu a city in eastern Congo to help
break a taboo of speaking openly about
rape why they held my feet one took my
left foot one took my right and the same
with my arms and they proceeded to rape
me the United Nations says Congo has the
worst sexual violence in the world
poverty disease and war have plagued
eastern Congo for decades foreign aid
agencies attribute the rape epidemic to
this chaos when I met with rape
survivors from this area last fall they
spoke about being assaulted only from
behind closed doors and in whispers but
at this event five women stood in front
of a crowd of several hundred people and
described in forceful language being
gang raped shot enslaved and infected
with HIV they started slapping me and I
hit my face yeah they said to me lie
down I lay down on my side but they said
lie on your back and I did then they
told my father in law sleep with that
woman there and my father-in-law said
that can't happen nobody was talking
about this phenomenon it was it was
taboo it still is taboo yet these
discussions are revealing just how
pervasive the sexual and gender-based
violence is
Eve Ensler the American playwright who
wrote The Vagina Monologues is one of
several activists who are trying to help
protect the women here I think we just
have to keep doing educational advocacy
dialoguing women breaking the silence
women speaking up and eventually my
dream is that the movement of women will
be n men will be so strong here that the
violence will have to stop thousands of
rapes still go unpunished countless men
from rebel fighters to police officers
to husbands and brothers get away with
assaulting women but recent efforts by
international organizations and the
Congolese government are changing that
gradually mean that yeah this'll totally
dick he said now some government
officials are getting involved in the
struggle such as judicial authorities
political and administrative authorities
police authorities the army everyone got
involved so everyone is seeking to stop
rapists there really is an improvement
most people believe that peace is the
only real solution and that may not come
any time soon
Oh
